intro: Kengia hackelii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in spring. The tree can grow up to 15 meters tall, with smooth, grey bark and compound leaves that are alternate and pinnate. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in local habitats.
